layout.p: Columns: 1; ruled lines: 40 50; written lines: 40 50; Non-uniform layout.Numerous additions and comments in the margin.Folios 22v, 26v-31r left blank.Some sections crossed out by the author (e.g., folio 2v, 8v, 9r, etc.). Folios 1 and 2 are title-pages.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive script of the latter part of the 16th century. The autograph of Mordecai ben Judah Dato.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Mordechai Dato. Hymns, Etc. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,096. 27,097.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 203: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see Paisey, David. 'Adolphus Asher (1800-1853): Berlin bookseller, Anglophile, and friend to Panizzi' British Library Journal 23 (1997), 131-153).
